function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Using traditional fixed parameter regression models without considering dynamic factors may lead to inaccurate insights into the relationship between COVID-19 fatality rate, obesity, and the built environment.","Impact":"Inaccurate insights could result in ineffective policy decisions and resource allocations for mitigating contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Consider incorporating dynamic factors and updated data sources into regression models to account for changing conditions and factors affecting disease spread.","Technologies":"Dynamic regression models, machine learning algorithms for data analysis.","People":"Policy makers, public health officials, epidemiologists.","Owner":"Data scientists, researchers, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Unobserved heterogeneity in regression models can lead to biased estimates and incorrect conclusions about the impact of built and natural environments on the spread of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Biased estimates can lead to misinformed public health interventions and ineffective mitigation strategies.","Mitigation":"Use random parameter models to account for unobserved heterogeneity, and incorporate maximum simulated likelihood procedures for estimation.","Technologies":"Random parameter models, maximum simulated likelihood procedures, data simulation techniques.","People":"Researchers, statisticians, data scientists.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Inadequate consideration of heterogeneity parameters and densities in the regression model could lead to inappropriate characterizations of unobserved factors related to contagious diseases.","Impact":"Inappropriate characterizations can result in incorrect policy recommendations and ineffective disease control measures.","Mitigation":"Comprehensively test different densities such as normal, lognormal, triangular, uniform, and Weibull distributions to identify the most suitable characterization for unobserved factors.","Technologies":"Statistical modeling software, simulation tools for density testing.","People":"Quantitative researchers, statisticians, data analysts.","Owner":"Research institutions, statistical organizations."}]}
